intro: Mammillaria vonwyssiana, commonly known as the Württemberg prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, which are followed by red, spherical fruits. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care, it is a popular choice for succulent collections.
